author: MTP34
text: A return to form that feels completely new. Tyler deconstructs his own mythos while building a sonic landscape that is as abrasive as it is beautiful.
content:
CHROMAKOPIA stands as a testament to evolution. Where IGOR was a polished persona, this album is raw, exposed, and glitchy.

The production draws heavily from industrial noise and classic soul samples, creating a friction that shouldn't work but does.

"It's chaos, but controlled chaos. Like a orchestrated car crash."

Essential listening for anyone tracking the trajectory of modern hip-hop.

author: Guest Critic
text: A ghostly transmission from a city that no longer exists. Burial strips away the drums and leaves only the atmosphere.
content: This is music for the spaces between moments. It feels less like an album and more like a collection of memories fading in real-time.
